body_html:
@guolinke At the moment boundaries is passed as an attributes. It is certainly possible to pass it as a tensor, though that means we may need to have a BucketizeV2 op to make it backward compatible. There also might be some implications on GPU implementation so some changes might be needed.

Can you open a new issue for this feature request?

@guolinke At the moment boundaries is passed as an attributes. It is certainly possible to pass it as a tensor, though that means we may need to have a BucketizeV2 op to make it backward compatible. There also might be some implications on GPU implementation so some changes might be needed.

body:
@guolinke At the moment `boundaries` is passed as an attributes. It is certainly possible to pass it as a `tensor`, though that means we may need to have a `BucketizeV2` op to make it backward compatible. There also might be some implications on GPU implementation so some changes might be needed.

Can you open a new issue for this feature request?
